docs.snippet: The Yankees’ Michael Pineda was suspended for 10 games on Thursday after being ejected at Fenway Park for having pine tar brazenly smeared on his neck....
docs.lead_paragraph: The Yankees’ Michael Pineda was suspended for 10 games on Thursday after being ejected at Fenway Park for having pine tar brazenly smeared on his neck.
docs.abstract: Tyler Kepner On Baseball column holds that the most prevalent takeaway from New York Yankees pitcher Michael Pineda's 10-game suspension, is how brazen he was to have pine tar smeared across the side of his neck; questions how he could be so careless after being caught with pine tar once before.

docs.snippet: The formal title of an event Saturday underscores the harsh truth that, for all its pastoral charms, baseball is a fickle, difficult business: “The Newark Bears Baseball Team Liquidation.”...
docs.lead_paragraph: The formal title of an event Saturday underscores the harsh truth that, for all its pastoral charms, baseball is a fickle, difficult business: “The Newark Bears Baseball Team Liquidation.”
docs.abstract: Dan Barry This Land column on the demise of Newark Bears, minor league baseball team; it is auctioning off everything and formal title of event--The Newark Bears Baseball Team Liquidation--underscores the harsh truth that, for all its pastoral charms, professional baseball is a fickle, difficult business.

headline.seo: Newark Bears Are Holding a Liquidation Auction
